title: Is it true that love makes faith and hope possible? Is that why it’s biblically the greatest of the three? - Quora

response.answer_text: Answer to the first question: Yes. Answer to the second question: Probably. St. Paul writes: “if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but have not love, I am nothing.” (1 Corinthians‬ 13:2‬) Faith is the adherence to God. Hope is for God; hope in anything apart from God is useless. Love, however, is the very nature of God. “He who does not love does not know God; for God is love.” (1 John‬ 4:8‬)

Yes love is the greatest of all three. Why? When you love others including yourself then everything else good such as hope will follow. People know a man or woman of God within the first five minutes of a conversation Although faith is believing. But remember that going through trials and tribulations will help you grow stronger in life. Especially when you turn to God in times of troubles instead of getting mad and turning away from him.
